Root.Key: Are you ready to face the Story of the Assistant Librarians? (You may progress the story only by losing this reception after fulfilling certain conditions)
Will you proceed with the reclamation of the Library?
Will you view the final story of Angela?
Will you view the first epilogue?
Accept her proposal.
Decline. Kill her and walk your own path.
Angela's Incomplete Page
Suppression of Angelos Succeeded
Suppression of Angelos Failed
Granulated Seed of Light
The Emotions of all allies build up twice as fast. All Emotion Points that allies gain are changed to Negative.
Rebellion of Assistant Librarians
Select a Midnight E.G.O
Ayin
Dice Power +{0}. Can stack up to {1}.
Destructible
Indestructable
The Perfect Meal
On a successful hit, if the natural roll is neither Min nor Max, deal damage equal to 1/3 of the roll.
Barley Hill
Deal damage equal to 10% of target's Max. HP and recover HP equal to it. (Up to 10)
The Food Chain
On a successful hit, if the natural roll is neither Min nor Max, deal damage equal to 1/3 of the roll.
The Eternal Meal
Inflict 1 Feeble and Disarm to target this Scene and next Scene and gain 1 Strength and Endurance this Scene and next Scene.
Faith - Prophecy
Increase target's Fate by 1. If target's Fate is 20 or higher, restore 1 Light instead.
Faith - Resonance
Treat the opponent's die as an Evade die, and activating [On Clash Win] effect
Faith - Assault
Inflict 1 Stagger Fragile this Scene and next Scene
Faith - Moonlight
3 random allies recover HP equal to the damage dealt
Faith - Time
On a successful hit, deal 1 more additional Stagger damage
Faith - Silence
Recover Stagger Resist equal to the amount of Stagger damage dealt with dice from this page
I look towards tomorrow, yet I see nothing. Running endlessly towards a vague light.
Was there a reason we had to be trapped in this bridle of time?
That annoyingly persistent Script still resonates within my head.
Even the slightest struggle is buried under darkness, fading the light.
I, for what...
How could you all be so cruel?
Did I not hold a worth, from beginning to end.
Sorrow overflows, pelting the world with a flooding brash.
Ayin, I resent you.
Having stomped me down, you stand here to rip me out by the roots.
Did you hate me so? Did you resent me so?
As you resent me, so do I.
I embrace them. Those crushed together soothe each other's wounds.
Standing on yet another stage, what do I search for?
I remember you, Ayin.
You, who threw us all into an abysm with cruelty.
As always, you revert all, crush all, for your ideal.
What else could I do?
No matter how much I struggle, everyone is stomped under a heel, and the Stage is but set again.
If I'd never shown up in the first place, would've all been right?
Did my childish hopes ruin everything instead?
...Answer for me, whoever's out there. What do I do...?
I don't want to die, but I don't want to see any longer.
I don't want to bear witness to this purgatory I can't change any longer.
If all of this was derived from my foolish mind, then instead...
We lost our lives, trapped in this abysm.
Not something we consented to in the first place, yet only met with agony.
To what end does the cruelty of the City exploit the humans, residing within.
How is it that those attempting to escape their chains forgets the bridles they placed upon others.
For how long must we endure this pain and cower?
We've suffered enough.
Wrath lost in direction will settle and stack, creating a mace to crush the world.
This is what you've earned. A resentment deserved.
The past you've all tried so hard to ignore shall descend upon you.
Something that would've been different, had they had looked back even once.
Was even a passing glance too much to give?
It's for these forgotten children.
If you don't step up, nothing will change.
Do you still believe them?
Act in stead for those children.
Don't give up. For your kin is in agony.
For this is the only salvation for them all.
...Let us begin.
Not enough.
